page.title: 18SHEEP FARMING
page.content: The sheep raised are Schots,Teeswaters and their cross Mashams.Mashams are raised for breeding and there may be up to 800 in a flock.They are kept on pasture all the year and looked after by one shepherd.They lamb in Spring and the female(gimmer)lambs are sold at a year old(shearlings)in Masham for breeding, some being retained for the farmers flock.The male(tup)lambs are fattened for slaughter.Turnips are grown for them to feed on.Shearing is in June/July and the wool is sent to Bradford.The sheep are dipped regularly according to government regulations to prevent disease such as sheep scab.Some farmers also raise suckling calves which are sold at a year old.Breeds being Friesian, Hereford and Aberdeen Angus.
